meanings.definition: Cover with a thin layer of gold.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to gild her favorite necklace for a special occasion.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a brush to carefully gild the picture frame.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to gild the rabbit, but it didn't turn into gold!
meanings.sent4: His smile seemed to gild the room with warmth and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The setting sun appeared to gild the clouds with a golden hue.

meanings.definition: Give a specious or false brilliance to.
meanings.sent1: The salesman tried to gild the product with exaggerated claims.
meanings.sent2: The movie used special effects to gild the scenes and make them more exciting.
meanings.sent3: The chef attempted to gild the burnt dish with extra spices, but it still tasted bad.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to gild the room with joy and lightness.
meanings.sent5: The fake smile only served to gild the insincerity of his words.

meanings.definition: To give an attractive but often deceptive appearance to.
meanings.sent1: The company tried to gild their reputation by sponsoring charity events.
meanings.sent2: The makeup artist used shimmer to gild the model's cheeks and make them glow.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to gild their essay with fancy words to impress the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises were meant to gild his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The old building was gilded with bright paint to hide its age.
